member.name: T:checkAnomalyCompNative.CheckAnomalyClass
member.summary:
The CheckAnomalyClass class provides a CLS compliant, Object (native) interface to the MATLAB functions contained in the files:
C:\Users\robertstarkey\OneDrive\Documents\MATLAB\checkAnomaly.m

member.summary: The static constructor instantiates and initializes the MATLAB Runtime instance.

member.name: M:checkAnomalyCompNative.CheckAnomalyClass.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the native resources associated with this object

member.name: M:checkAnomalyCompNative.CheckAnomalyClass.checkAnomaly
member.summary: Provides a void output, 0-input Objectinterface to the checkAnomaly MATLAB function.
member.remarks: M-Documentation: Function to check if a new sensor reading is an anomaly based on historical data. Inputs: historicalData - Matrix of historical readings (each row represents a reading from 5 sensors). newReading - Row vector representing the new sensor reading to analyze. k - Number of nearest neighbors to consider. anomalyThreshold - Threshold for determining if the new reading is an anomaly.

member.name: M:checkAnomalyCompNative.CheckAnomalyClass.WaitForFiguresToDie
member.summary: This method will cause a MATLAB figure window to behave as a modal dialog box. The method will not return until all the figure windows associated with this component have been closed.
member.remarks: An application should only call this method when required to keep the MATLAB figure window from disappearing. Other techniques, such as calling Console.ReadLine() from the application should be considered where possible.
